intro: Cyanea ferox, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and rugged, woody structure. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Cyanea ferox is known for its slow growth and ability to thrive in rocky, coastal environments. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
